page.title: 04HOUSING IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content:
Housing in Cruden Bay consists of various types. The village began as a group of cottages, used mainly by fishermen and their families. This was called Port Erroll. There used to be a large Hotel situated at the South end of the village(demolished in 1945). Several bungalows were built on the road leading up to the Hotel.As the oil
Industry grew in the '70s more houses were built. A Council Estate of wooden Norwegian-type houses were built at the south end and a private Estate was built by Barratt on the hill above the original village. This greatly increased the village population, and therefore included a new school to accommodate 210 children.
